attributes.action: Allow open book exams for English literature GCSE students.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of students are incapable of memorising even 1 text and it gives them an unfair advantage to past students who have been allowed their passages into their exams with them. As well as this, teenagers already get anxiety and stress over exams and having them learn multiple different texts with complex language will not help nor improve their performance. In fact, it will only make their actions worse because their minds will be filled with all these texts and they can’t think straight.
attributes.background: Allow students to take the required poems/ extracts that they need for their English literature GCSE.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Open book exams for GCSE and A-level students sitting exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327397

Make the English GCSE exam open book: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326265
